meanings.sent1: The old, duddy couch in the corner needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent2: The duddy curtains in the room were faded and torn.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat avoided sitting on the duddy armchair.
meanings.sent4: The duddy sweater looked like it had seen better days.
meanings.sent5: The duddy car had rust spots all over its body.

meanings.definition: A person who is dull or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of duddies who just sat in the corner.
meanings.sent2: She always avoided talking to the duddy at work.
meanings.sent3: The duddy at the party fell asleep in the middle of a joke.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a duddy in a room full of lively personalities.
meanings.sent5: The duddy in the group never had any exciting stories to share.

meanings.sent1: The duddy book on the shelf hadn't been touched in years.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the kids came in with duddy shoes.
meanings.sent3: The duddy windows made it hard to see outside clearly.
meanings.sent4: The duddy attic was filled with forgotten treasures under a layer of dust.
meanings.sent5: The duddy path through the forest was barely visible under the dirt.
